key.name: form-factor
key.summary: The form factor Unity should target.
key.description: The form factor chosen will affect the size and appearance of the Dash, Launcher and also the Window Management behaviour.

key.name: home-expanded
key.summary: Whether the home screen should be expanded.
key.description: Whether the home screen should be expanded.

key.name: desktop-type
key.summary: The current desktop name.
key.description: The current desktop name.

key.name: minimize-count
key.summary: Number of times a normal window has been minimized.
key.description: This is used to adjust the animation speed by making it progressively faster the more it is used.

key.name: minimize-fast-duration
key.summary: The duration for the minimize animation when it is at its fastest setting.
key.description: This is the duration that the minimize animation will have when it has been used more than an number of times equal minimize-speed-threshold.

key.name: minimize-slow-duration
key.summary: The duration for the minimize animation when it is at its slowest setting.
key.description: This is the duration that the minimize animation will have when it has never been used.

key.name: minimize-speed-threshold
key.summary: The number of minimizations required to reach maximum speed.
key.description: The speed of the minimize animation will progressively get faster as minimize-count approaches this value.

key.name: double-click-activate
key.summary: Enable/Disable dash result double-click activation.
key.description: This is used to enable/disable double-click result activation in the dash. Double-click to activate, single click preview

key.name: integrated-menus
key.summary: Enable/Disable the integrated menus in Unity.
key.description: When this is enabled, the application menus will be shown on the window decoration, otherwise they will be always shown on the unity top panel

key.name: show-menus-now-delay
key.summary: Delay (in ms) before showing the menus when pressing Alt
key.description: This allows tune the delay before presenting unity menus (in non always-show-menus mode).

key.name: always-show-menus
key.summary: Toggle the menu visibility based on mouse hovering.
key.description: When this is enabled, the application menus will be always shown (on the window decoration or in the unity panel, depending whether integrated menus are enabled), otherwise they will be shown only when the mouse cursor is over the relative mouse area.

key.name: whitelist-repeated-keys
key.summary: List of keycodes that should be processed even if auto-repated.
key.description: These keycodes are processed even if they are auto-repeated.

key.name: pam-check-account-type
key.summary: Enable/Disable PAM account checking
key.description: Whether PAM should check the result of account modules when authenticating. Only do this if you have account configured properly on your system.

key.name: lowgfx
key.summary: Enable/Disable Low Graphics Mode
key.description: Whether Unity runs in Low Graphics Mode.

key.name: text-scale-factor
key.summary: Font scaling for unity and applications.
key.description: This value defines the global font scaling used by both unity and applications. It will match the current system font scaling.

key.name: cursor-scale-factor
key.summary: Mouse cursor scaling.
key.description: This value defines the global mouse cursor scaling used by both unity and applications. Changing this value allows to use a custom scaling for the mouse cursor.

key.name: app-scale-factor-monitor
key.summary: The name of the monitor that controls the global app scaling factor.
key.description: This value defines the monitor that unity will use (if found) as reference for scaling all the applications.

key.name: app-fallback-to-maximum-scale-factor
key.summary: Use the maximum per-monitor scale-factor as application scale factor if no target monitor is found.
key.description: When this is enabled, the applications scale factor will match the scale factor of the monitor with the greater value, in case the monitor defined in 'app-scale-factor-monitor' is not provided or available.

key.name: favorites
key.summary: List of items that should be shown by default in the launcher
key.description: These items can be: application://desktop-id.desktop, device://uiid and unity://special-id (including: unity://running-apps (icons of running applications) unity://devices (icons of attached devices), unity://expo-icon (icon of the workspace switcher) and unity://desktop-icon (the show-desktop icon)); the order of this list determines the launcher item's position.

key.name: items
key.summary: List of items that should be shown by default in the launcher
key.description: These items can be: application:///desktop-id.desktop or appid://package/app/current-user-version.

key.name: favorite-migration
key.summary: Version of last migration done
key.description: This is a detection key for the favorite migration script to know whether the needed migration is done or not.

key.name: launcher-position
key.summary: The position of launcher.
key.description: The position of launcher.

key.name: blacklist
key.summary: List of device uuid blacklist from the launcher.
key.description: These devices are not shown in the launcher by default.

key.name: scopes
key.summary: List of scope ids specifying which scopes should be created and the order to display them in.
key.description: The scopes listed in the scope bar will be ordered according to this list.

key.name: favorite-scopes
key.summary: List of scope queries specifying what should be displayed in the dash.
key.description: List of favorite scopes displayed in the dash.

key.name: grab-wait
key.summary: Milliseconds to wait before considering a mouse pressure a grab
key.description: The number of ms to wait before starting the window movement (and then showing the proper mouse cursor, and grabbing the window)

key.name: click-movement-threshold
key.summary: Number of pixels to ignore on mouse pressure
key.description: This value define how many pixels the user can move the mouse when holding the mouse button, before we consider his action a movement (to grab the window).

key.name: double-click-wait
key.summary: Milliseconds to wait before activating a menu after mouse release
key.description: The number of ms to wait after a mouse button release event before considering it a click. When this value is greater than 0, then it's possible to maximize a window by double-clicking on its menus if the second click happens before the specified value of ms is elapsed

key.name: unfocused-windows-popup
key.summary: Whether to pop-up a menu when clicking over unfocused windows entries
key.description: By disabling this setting you can make unity to only focus a window when clicking over unfocused menu entries

key.name: launcher-drag
key.summary: Multi-touch gesture to reveal the launcher.
key.description: When this is enabled, a 4 finger swipe from left to right will reveal launcher, provided that the launcher is set to auto-hide.

key.name: dash-tap
key.summary: Multi-touch gesture to open the dash.
key.description: When this is enabled, a 4 finger tap will open the dash.

key.name: windows-drag-pinch
key.summary: Multi-touch gestures to manage the windows.
key.description: When this is enabled, 3 finger gestures such as drag, and pinch, will help manage the windows.
